item.title: Accessibility expert warns: stop using carousels
item.description: Jared Smith slams UI elements that are detrimental to users
item.dc:creator: Craig Grannell

item.title: Responsive design: we are not there yet
item.description: There's still some way to go before designing responsively becomes a smooth process, warns Anselm Hannemann
item.dc:creator: Anselm Hannemann

item.title: Five killer ways to create delight
item.description: Gene Crawford explains how adding just the tiniest morsel of wonderment can keep your users coming back for more
item.dc:creator: Gene Crawford

item.title: John McFaul on his talk for Generate
item.description: Our very first conference, Generate, is taking place in September. John McFaul will deliver an inspirational talk on how he's managed to bring his personal passions into his working life, and here he gives us a sneak-peek of what he's going to say
item.dc:creator: Tanya Combrinck

item.title: Open Device Lab reaches 1,000 bits of kit
item.description: LabUp! urges web industry folk to donate devices and start new labs
item.dc:creator: Craig Grannell

item.title: 5 HTML5 and ARIA design patterns
item.description: With HTML5 and ARIA now in regular use across the web, several design patterns are emerging that solve common scenarios. This article takes five HTML5 and ARIA design patterns and explains why they make good design choices
item.dc:creator: Léonie Watson and Steve Faulkner

item.title: Paul Boag asks: one site or many?
item.description: Could more brands benefit from utilising micro-sites?
item.dc:creator: Craig Grannell

item.title: New tools for web design and development: June 2013
item.description: Mark Penfold looks at 10 of the best tools to come out in June
item.dc:creator: Mark Penfold

item.title: Tyler Galpin on ditching banking for design
item.description: Lost Type Co-op co-founder Tyler Galpin nearly ended up a banker rather than a designer. He chats to Martin Cooper about pivot tables, geometric typefaces and the after-effects of facial dog bites
item.dc:creator: Martin Cooper

item.title: Christian Heilmann: embrace openness for the web’s future
item.description: Mozilla dev argues the web industry has lost its way and needs to pivot
item.dc:creator: Craig Grannell

item.title: How to test on real devices
item.description: How do you sustain solid quality assurance these days while everyone is fighting an uphill battle against a flood of new internet devices? It’s rather simple. Andre Jay Meissner tells you how
item.dc:creator: Andre Jay Meissner

item.title: 20 top freelancing tips
item.description: There’s more to freelancing than deciding what tools to use. Craig Grannell interviews web industry folk who’ve gone it alone to unearth their top tips
item.dc:creator: Craig Grannell

item.title: Devs warn: don't get lax on code
item.description: Shortcuts and aesthetics-first can undermine usability and derail working code
item.dc:creator: Craig Grannell

item.title: Accessible RWD
item.description: With the rise in popularity for responsive web design, Alastair Campbell says websites need to be accessible, too
item.dc:creator: Alastair Campbell

item.title: Responsively retrofit older sites
item.description: You can use responsive techniques on older sites as a first step toward better small-screen experiences. Check your idealism at the door, says Ben Callahan
item.dc:creator: Ben Callahan

item.title: Aral Balkan launches open platform initiative
item.description: Codename Prometheus to compete on user experience in the consumer space
item.dc:creator: Craig Grannell

item.title: Dan Donald and Jack Sheppard on Speak the Web
item.description: Dan Donald and Jack Sheppard tell us about two projects: Speak the Web and Break the Page. Speak the Web is a series of web talks taking place in the north of England that mimics the style of a band tour. Break the Page is a 'playground for ideas' relating to web design
item.dc:creator: Tanya Combrinck

item.title: Using Bootstrap for complex design systems
item.description: Melanie Archer explains how General Electric use Twitter Bootstrap
item.dc:creator: Melanie Archer

item.title: 7digital launches first Firefox OS music store
item.description: 25 million tracks now available on Mozilla’s mobile OS
item.dc:creator: Craig Grannell

item.title: Hot in web standards: May/June 2013
item.description: Lea Verou on the latest developments at the W3C
item.dc:creator: Lea Verou

item.title: H&FJ launch Cloud.typography
item.description: 100 per cent CSS web font solution for design professionals
item.dc:creator: Craig Grannell

item.title: Mike Thomas on taking the pain out of recruitment
item.description: Mike Thomas and Paul Macgregor have created OnSite, a service that aims to make it easier for digital agencies to find designers and developers with the right skills for their projects
item.dc:creator: Tanya Combrinck

item.title: Understanding CSS and the modern web
item.description: In the first chapter of his book, CSS3 Foundations, Ian Lunn explains what the modern web is and why CSS is so important to it
item.dc:creator: Ian Lunn

item.title: Firefox 23 to hide ‘Disable JavaScript’ option
item.description: Option to migrate to dev tools as of Firefox 24
item.dc:creator: Craig Grannell

item.title: Andy Thomas on fruitful client relationships
item.description: Huge’s creative director Andy Thomas talks about pushing pixels, keeping creative and prioritising prototyping for projects
item.dc:creator: Martin Cooper
